page.title: 08SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: There are only primary schools in our area, so pupils over eleven travel to Bracknell for secondary schooling. Many Binfield pupils attend Garth Hill School. As Binfield is built on top of a hill the journey is a pleasant one through picturesque scenery, but the return, uphill, is tiring. School begins at 8.55 with registration. There are 8 thirty-five minute lessons each day with a break after each two. The longest break is at lunch-time. Lunch is eaten in the cafeteria whether bought there,or brought from home. There is a wide variety of subjects taught at the school, from which older pupils choose options for public examinations in the 5th & 7th years. Most pupils leave school at 16 years, but there is a 6th form of about 130 pupils. Pupils enjoy sports, drama and music outside lessons.
